title: Katie Ledecky passes Michael Phelps for most individual golds at world championships
description: The 26-year-old American won the 800-meter freestyle on Saturday at the world championships to become the first swimmer to win six golds in the same event at worlds.

title: Rep. Van Orden gets bipartisan scolding after he cursed at teen Senate pages
description: GOP and Democratic lawmakers alike condemned the Wisconsin Republican after he spewed profanities at a group of Senate pages taking photos at the Capitol.

title: Almost nothing has come from all the talk about states banning drag in front of kids
description: Across the country, efforts by state Republicans to restrict drag performances in front of kids have fallen short. Bills have been scuttled, blocked, vetoed and more.

title: A WWII Japanese soldier's 'good luck flag' is returned to his family from U.S. museum
description: The flag belonging to Shigeyoshi Mutsuda was returned to his son from a U.S. war museum where it had been on display for 29 years. "It's a miracle," 83-year-old Toshihiro Mutsuda said.

title: After rebranding, X took @x from its original Twitter owner and offered him merch
description: Gene X Hwang owned @x on Twitter. Until Elon Musk rebranded the platform and took the handle.

title: Mega Millions jackpot passes $1 billion after no one draws all 6 winning numbers
description: The next drawing for the grand prize, which is equal to the fourth-largest Mega Millions jackpot to date, is Tuesday. Just last week, a winning ticket for a $1.08 billion Powerball drawing was sold.

title: What recession? It's a summer of splurging, profits and girl power
description: Economic data show higher prices and constant warnings of a downturn haven't slowed down American shoppers. The Fed is anxious. Companies are thrilled.

title: In Peru, discovery of ancient ruins outpaces authorities' ability to care for them
description: "Everywhere you dig, you will find something — because Lima was home to great civilizations," says a museum director in the capital. "But it's impossible to save everything in a poor country."

title: As NYC limits access to migrants and asylum seekers, many are left homeless
description: New York City officials say they are overwhelmed by an influx of asylum seekers. Hundreds of immigrants are crowded into at least one detention center.

title: Presidential primaries have seen dramatic comebacks. Could DeSantis '24 be next?
description: Using the phrase "comeback kid" helped Bill Clinton revive his campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination in the 1992 New Hampshire primary. Could Ron DeSantis revive that model?

title: 4 air crew members are missing after an Australian army helicopter ditched off coast
description: Officials said the incident happened during joint military exercises with the U.S. A search involving U.S., Canadian and Australian personnel was underway to find the crew who are all Australian men.

title: Forecasters say Southwest temperatures to ease some with arrival of monsoon rains
description: Forecasters expect that by Monday at the latest, people in metro Phoenix will begin seeing high temperatures under 110 degrees Fahrenheit for the first time in a month.

title: Soldiers declare Niger general as head of state following coup
description: Mutinous soldiers who staged a coup in Niger declared their leader, Gen. Abdourahmane Tchiani, the new head of state on Friday. A spokesman also said that the constitution was suspended.

title: 'X' logo installed atop Twitter building, spurring San Francisco to investigate
description: City officials say replacing letters or symbols on buildings requires a permit for design and safety reasons. The installation is part of Elon Musk's effort to rebrand the social media platform.

title: Biden has a 7th grandchild. But he's never acknowledged her, until now
description: President Biden is known for his close relationship with his grandchildren. But he hadn't recognized a 4-year-old daughter of Hunter Biden from his family, until Friday.
